intro: Cnicus semenowi, commonly known as the Armenian sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, hairy leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces small, ribbed seeds that are dispersed by wind. Cnicus semenowi is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
